author: Staff Reporter
text:
It is being distributed as per the Chief Minister’s announcement

Walking or travelling under the sun is a tiring experience, more so with the mercury level beginning to soar in Vellore.

Taxing days are ahead for traffic police personnel regulating vehicle movement at key junctions and arterial stretches.

To help them beat the heat, the police department will be providing lime juice and butter milk everyday. The initiative, which is being carried out as per the direction of the State government, was launched on Sunday.

G. Paneerselvam, deputy superintendent of police, Vellore sub-division distributed glasses of juice to traffic police personnel on Anna Salai.

A police officer said traffic police personnel across the district would be given juice to help them manage the hot days.

“This is being carried out as per the Chief Minister’s earlier announcement. We will be distributing lime juice and buttermilk to traffic personnel everyday. As per this, juice and butter milk should be distributed to personnel every two hours,” an officer said.

There are eight traffic wings in the district.

In Vellore traffic division, there are nearly 40 personnel, while there are at least 10 personnel in each of the other seven divisions across the district, he added.

“Vellore is known for its hot days. It is not possible to keep standing under the umbrella provided for traffic personnel and regulate vehicle movement all through the day,” he said.

In Vellore traffic division, there are 40 personnel and 10 personnel each in 7 divisions
title: Juices to keep traffic police cool
